pros: Good team & good level of training
cons: No cons that are relevant to the job

pros:
Good Pay - You get a fair pay for what you have to do. 
friendly Colleagues - All team members are really friendly
cons:
Management don't really have a clue - The choices they make are never informed and they don't ask employees before making them. 
Quite stressful - At times you can be asked to do things that you wouldn't expect to do and be given a tiny period to do it in.

review_title: Average, good intentions but plenty of faults
pros: The senior management want you and the company to do well. They aren't just after money and care about their employees.
cons: Cliques, poor structures and systems. Everything is far too complicated and there are too many staff in some roles at head office and nowhere enough in others.
